title: Russia hits seat of Ukraine government in war's biggest air attack
subhead: The main building of the Ukrainian government in Kyiv was damaged after an overnight Russian barrage, marking the first time a government building has been hit in the over three-year-long war.

title: Norwegian NGOs warn of country's rising poverty levels
subhead: Norway's economy and social inequalities top voters' concerns ahead of the country's parliamentary elections on September 8. The cost of living has risen over the past three years, hitting the most vulnerable people the hardest.
byline: By Anne-Françoise Hivert (Oslo, Norway, special correspondent)

title: Will France's government collapse? Do the math with our simulator
subhead: To survive the confidence vote on September 8, Prime Minister François Bayrou must secure a majority of votes cast in the Assemblée Nationale. Abstentions and absences will not be counted.
byline: By Pierre Breteau and Maxime Vaudano

title: Venice Film Festival: Jim Jarmusch wins top prize while Palestine dominates awards ceremony
subhead: The Golden Lion went to 'Father Mother Sister and Brother' by the American filmmaker on Saturday, September 6, while 'The Voice of Hind Rajab' by Tunisian director Kaouther Ben Hania, about the death of five-year-old Hind in Gaza, won the Grand Jury Prize.
byline: By Boris Bastide (Venice, Italy, special correspondent)

title: Louise Trotter's understated style
subhead: 'Essence of a Style' (6/6). Appointed to the helm of some of the biggest fashion houses, six designers are set to command the industry's attention this season. We look back at what has defined their distinctive touch so far, before their trial by fire. In this final chapter, the former artistic director of Carven, who is now at Bottega Veneta.

title: 'Block Everything': Anger in France is deep, but mass strikes appear unlikely
subhead: The choice of a Wednesday for the planned September 10 protests raises questions about who has the option to strike, especially as labor disputes in French workplaces have been particularly rare in recent years.

title: Julia Kristeva, psychoanalyst and writer: 'The Trumpist deal is the complete absence of the social contract'
subhead: 'May '68 Thinkers Reflect On Trump Era (4/6). The author analyzes the current political climate, shaped by the ambitions of American and Russian leaders, but also by 'woke-ism' and a 'national depression.'
